body:
Comment 4 by **koloberdin**: 
What does MinGW have to do with it? Isn't Go supposed to use it's own compiler? (6c)

OK, the documentation ( http://golang.org/cmd/cgo/ ) says "Cgo transforms the input file
into four output files: two Go source files, a C file for 6c (or 8c or 5c), and a C file
for gcc."
So I guess I still need a proper gcc after all.
Will try installing mingw-64 and see what happens.
